channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The professions trying to get ahead with AI are those most likely to lose their jobs to it, St Louis Fed says
item.description: AI job losses may be starting to show up in U.S. data, with a St. Louis Fed study linking rising unemployment to industries adopting generative AI.

item.title: Thrive Capital’s Philip Clark is promoted to partner
item.description: Philip Clark has been promoted to partner at Thrive Capital, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Inside IKEA’s CEO succession plan: a lengthy listening tour and a handover that will take months
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: U.S. pulls TSMC’s waiver for China shipments of chip supplies
item.description: TSMC’s shares slid as much as 1.3% in Taipei, while suppliers including Tokyo Electron Ltd. fell about 2%.

item.title: The canary in the coal mine is singing as global bond selloff raises national debt concerns
item.description: Global bond yields surge toward multi-decade highs as U.S., U.K., and French debt concerns mount, while gold hits a record $3,537 amid investor flight...

item.title: Is the $1.3B Powerball lottery worth playing? What an MIT math professor says.
Why you need to save more cash right now — even if the Fed cuts rates
Treasury market pressured as September bond supply gives investors choices
Alphabet’s stock rising after Google antitrust ruling avoids worst-case scenario
